page.topic: OLE Automation of Mobile Synch from Alpha Anywhere Scripts

section.title: Requesting synchronization from a Alpha Anywhere Web Page (A5W)

step.description: On the form from which you want to request the synchronization, add a request as follows (see MainMenu.a5w):
The page requested will need to do the following (see MobileSync.a5w):
step.example: dim MobileSync as OLE::MSync.Sync dim MobileContext as OLE::MSync.SyncOption MobileContext.Load() MobileSync.SetOptionObject(MobileContext) MobileSync.DoSync()

section.title: Determining the Current User Name for MobileServer
section.description: The MobileServer prefixes the ODBC connection name with " _ ". In order to connect to the database Alpha Anywhere needs to determine the name of the current Mobile Server user. Solution: Use the OLE object MSync.SyncOption to determine the user name (see DemoNavigator.a5w):
section.example: dim MobileContext as OLE::MSync.SyncOption MobileContext.Load() session.A5WebDemo.MobileServerUserName = MobileContext.UserName

section.description: Example The code below uses MSync.SyncOption to determine the current user and then builds a connection string for the database.
section.example: ' Get the logged in user from Oracle using the ' automation object MSync.SyncOption dim MobileContext as OLE::MSync.SyncOption MobileContext.Load() MobileServerUserName = MobileContext.UserName ' Create the connection string based on the user name connectionstring = "{a5api=odbc, a5syntax=oraclelite, datasource=" + MobileServerUserName + "_A5WebDemo, username=A5WebDemo, password=A5WebDemo}"
